intro: Lomelosia transcaspica, commonly known as the Transcaspian lomelosia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small white or yellow flowers. Lomelosia transcaspica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
